attributes.action: Government to explain to explain Covid policy changes
attributes.additional_details: I would like parliament to debate in detail all aspects of the Governments Covid 19 strategy, showing evidence both for and against why strategy A rather than B should be followed and then, when a decision has ben made this is communicated to the public showing the working out and not as a one sided statement outlining carefully selected facts to sell the policy. In essence treating the public as reasonably intelligent and responsible and not fools to be cozened into acquiescence.
attributes.background: The government is constantly changing the levels of constraint that they apply to the people of Britain in regard to Covid 19 , Covid passports being a prime example. I have had two jabs then caught covid , I would have spread covid whilst holding this passport. negating its value.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about some decisions taken by the Government during the Covid-19 pandemic, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

The Government has published several documents outlining its strategy for tackling Covid-19, and there has been significant parliamentary scrutiny of the Government's response to Covid-19. In addition scientific evidence supporting the government response to coronavirus is published by the Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies (SAGE): https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/scientific-evidence-supporting-the-government-response-to-coronavirus-covid-19

If you want the Government's approach to Covid-19 to be subject to additional scrutiny, we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Launch a judge-led public inquiry into the Covid-19 pandemic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577292
